alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:33PM EST until December 21 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Delaware and Chenango Counties. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Broome and Susquehanna Counties. Chenango River At Greene affecting Chenango County. Chenango River At Chenango Forks affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. Chenango River At Sherburne affecting Chenango County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Vestal. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding begins at the intersection of Old Vestal and African Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Monday was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 845 AM EST.
